page.title: 13COPTHALL FARM
page.content: Copthall Farm is a dairy produce farm.They have {70}Fresian milking cows and 80 calves . They have 1 Hereford stud bull. Artificial insemination is used to produce a perfect Fresian breed. Some heifers mate with the Hereford Bull and produce meat calves. The farm does not slaughter the cows themselves,but sell them for slaughtering. The farmer owns 100 acres of land. Most of the land is used for grazing or silage.1 field is about 10 to 12 acres large.They do not grow any crops but grass.There are three different methods of storing grass,for cattle in winter.They are pickling,drying and freezing.This particular farm uses pickling.In May and June,when the grass is at its peak ,half the grazing area is used for grazing and the other half is used for silage.
